identificationModule.briefTitle: Collecting Tissue Samples for Future Research From Women Undergoing Surgery for Breast Cancer
identificationModule.officialTitle: Specialized Program of Research Excellence (SPORE) in Breast Cancer: Tissue and Specimen Collection

descriptionModule.briefSummary:
RATIONALE: Collecting and storing samples of tumor tissue from patients with breast cancer to study in the laboratory may help doctors learn more about cancer.

PURPOSE: This phase I study is collecting tissue samples for future research from women undergoing surgery for breast cancer.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription:
OBJECTIVES:

Primary

* Collect breast tissue for future research from women undergoing surgery for breast cancer.

Secondary

* Create microarrays by tumor type for internal use by Specialized Program of Research Excellence.

OUTLINE: Tumor tissue is collected and analyzed to create microarrays by tumor type for future research studies.

PROJECTED ACCRUAL: A total of 1,250 patients will be accrued for this study.

bioSpec.description: Tissue from diagnostic biopsies, as well as initial or follow-up surgical procedures for the treatment or prevention of breast cancer. No extra tissue is taken, only what is left over following clinical use will be retained for banking purposes.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Collect human breast tissues and associated clinical-pathologic data
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: At time of diagnosis, surgery, and throughout standard care and clinical follow-up.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
DISEASE CHARACTERISTICS:

* Undergoing surgery for breast cancer
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: Women undergoing biopsy or surgical procedures for the diagnosis, treatment, or prevention of breast cancer.

locations.facility: Robert H. Lurie Comprehensive Cancer Center at Northwestern University

contacts.name: Clinical Trials Office - Robert H. Lurie Comprehensive Cancer
